Theorom - 1 :- 

-> In a graph G,the sum of 
 the degree of all vertices 
 of all vertices of G is 
 equal to twice the number
 of edge of G. 

 deg(V1) +...+ deg(Vn)=2*e 

Proof :- 

-> Let f be any edge of graph 
 G. 
-> If f is a loop on vertex V1 
 then f is count twice when
 we count degree of vertex
 V1.
-> If f is incident on V1 and 
 V2 then f is count inn both 
 deg(V1) and deg(V2).so f 
 is count twice if we add 
 deg(V1) and deg(V2).
-> So that adding the degree
 of all vertices involves 
 counting twice of each 
 edge of G.
-> Therefore addtion of
 degree of all vertex is
 equal to twice of number 
 of edges.
